title: Traffic not routing optimally on xfinity (Riot Direct - sudden ping increase)
body:
Hi there - I recently upgraded form Performance 55 to Blast 200 on Xfinity and all of a sudden my in game ping went from 44 to 62. I am in Utah and I noticed that my traffic instead of routing through the Denver PoP on Riot Direct then straight to Chicago, it  is now backtracking to San Jose (Sunnyvale) California  then to Chicago. I've spoken to Riot support (no help) and to Xfinity (even less help). I've downgraded back to perfomance, power cycled everything etc etc and even got a new docsis 3.1 modem. I am at a loss. Xfinity and Riot have a peering agreement. Surely they can sort this?

Please help. I know 62 is playable but it is a noticeable increase from 44 and I've been stable at 44 for 2 years. 

Here is my traceroute:

  1     7 ms     8 ms     7 ms  96.120.96.77
  2     8 ms     7 ms     7 ms  po-104-rur02.orem.ut.utah.comcast.net [68.87.220.173]
  3     8 ms     8 ms     8 ms  162.151.9.193
  4    24 ms    26 ms    24 ms  be-33660-cr02.sunnyvale.ca.ibone.comcast.net [68.86.90.145]
  5    27 ms    26 ms    26 ms  be-11025-cr01.9greatoaks.ca.ibone.comcast.net [68.86.87.158]
  6    31 ms    24 ms    24 ms  hu-0-15-0-0-pe03.11greatoaks.ca.ibone.comcast.net [68.86.86.210]
  7    34 ms    36 ms    34 ms  50.248.116.198
  8    35 ms    34 ms    35 ms  104.160.130.46
  9    39 ms    37 ms    35 ms  104.160.159.102
 10    53 ms    53 ms    52 ms  ae34-br01.chi01.riotdirect.net [104.160.159.22]
 11    55 ms    53 ms    54 ms  104.160.131.101
 12    54 ms    54 ms    53 ms  192.64.170.1

replies.body: Yea that really doesn't look like an optimal route to me either if it's hopping all over the place like that. Since your ISP is sending your connection in such a weird way, you might have a little better luck by using a VPN to route your connection in a slightly different way to get your ping back to where it used to be.

Back when you had the Chicago mega thread a couple of years ago my traffic was being routed the same way then "your engineers talked to their engineers" and it was sorted out fairly soon. Is this not something that the Riot Direct team can look into?

The amount of time this will take to sort isnt worth 18ms. Chances are the isp had to reroute traffic due to some internal issue. Wait it out and it should return to normal. Its on the comcast end so nothing you do will ever change the route.
